 How Pirates Work
 In "Pirates
of the Caribbean," Johnny Depp shows us a
comical view of piracy, but pirates are actually a real menace that have
existed throughout maritime history. Today pirates are a threat to merchant
ships, cargo vessels, cruise lines and even private boats enjoying some time on
the water. Discover the seedy world of piracy, learn some pirate history and find
out whether anyone really was made to walk the plank.
Also at HowStuffWorks
 

Breast
Cancer In-Depth - Breast
cancer affects more than 200,000 women in the United States every year, though it
can even be found in men. In this article, learn everything you need to know
about breast cancer, including facts about about early diagnosis, risk factors and options
for treatment.
 

How
Homeschooling Works - Up to 2
million children may be homeschooled in the United States, but it's a subject
that we don't often hear about. It's also a practice that's been gaining
popularity in recent years. Find out how homeschooling works and the methods
used by parents in educating their children.
 

How
Freemasons Work - George
Washington was one. So were Benjamin Franklin, Paul Revere and Henry Ford. All
of these illustrious and influential men were Freemasons (or Masons) --
privileged members of the world's oldest and largest fraternity. Learn about
the Freemasons, an enigmatic society with 5 million members worldwide.



This Week's Video

Beer
Myths - Beer
before liquor makes you sicker? Just another myth that's been spread to tarnish
beer's good name. In this video from HowStuffWorks, watch as we dispel some
common myths about beer.
